title: Postpartum Depression Signs
text: Common signs of postpartum depression include persistent sadness, anxiety, irritability, loss of interest in the baby, sleep disturbances, and feelings of hopelessness. It's important to seek professional help if these symptoms continue.

title: Prenatal Checkup Frequency
text: Prenatal checkups are typically scheduled once a month until 28 weeks, every two weeks until 36 weeks, and weekly from 36 weeks to delivery. These visits help monitor the health of both mother and baby.

title: Post-Birth Emergency Symptoms
text: Symptoms that require immediate medical attention after birth include severe headache, chest pain, heavy vaginal bleeding, shortness of breath, or thoughts of harming oneself or the baby. Call emergency services or go to the hospital immediately.

title: Low-Cost Maternal Health Support
text: Low-cost maternal health support is available through community health clinics, Medicaid, and nonprofit organizations. Federally Qualified Health Centers (FQHCs) often provide care on a sliding scale based on income.

title: Prenatal Care Importance
text: Prenatal care is essential to ensure the health of the mother and baby. It includes regular medical visits, screenings, nutritional advice, and early detection of potential complications. Consistent care improves outcomes for both.
